page.title: 19LEISURE
page.content: Widdrington and Hadston are small places and cater only for people's basic needs. A big lack is the provision of facilities fo recreation. The nearest Sports and Leisure Centre is at Ashington, some ten miles away, and the nearest cinema is at Morpeth, about the same distance away. Public transport by road to these places is not very frequent and it is expensive. The only alternative is a car - for those fortunate enough to have one. The Working Men's Club at Widdrington provides recreation for adults and occasional Discos for young people are held there. There is a weekly youth club at Hadston. The nearby beach is the only alternative for young people.
